calculator

Class CalculatorValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • calculator.CalculatorValue

  • public class CalculatorValue
extends java.lang.Object

    Title: CalculatorValue Class.

    Description: A component of a JavaFX demonstration application that performs computations wiht the help of UNUmber library

    Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter © 2017

    Version:
    4.4 2018-02-27 Double implementation of the CalculatorValue class, 4.5 2018-03-06 Implementation of ErrorTerm, 4.6 2019-07-26 Computation of all the operators by using the UNumber library and performa its error term also
    Author:
    Lynn Robert Carter and Aastik Gautam

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue()
        This is the default constructor

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(double v)
        This constructor creates a calculator value based on a double. For future calculators, it is best to avoid using this constructor.
        Parameters:
        v - = create the calculator value based on a double

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(CalculatorValue v)
        This copy constructor creates a duplicate of an already existing calculator value
        Parameters:
        v - = calculate the error term

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(java.lang.String s)
        This constructor creates a calculator value from a string... Due to the nature of the input, there is a high probability that the input has errors, so the routine returns the value with the error message value set to empty or the string of an error message.
        Parameters:
        s - = create calculator value from string

      • add

        public void add(CalculatorValue v)
        The following methods implement computation of addition on the calculator values. These routines assume that the caller has verified that things are okay for the operation to take place. This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits. Since this is addition and we do not yet support units, we don't recognize any errors.
        Parameters:
        v - pass the parameters for the computations

      • sub

        public void sub(CalculatorValue v)
        The following methods implement computation of subtraction on the calculator values. These routines assume that the caller has verified that things are okay for the operation to take place. This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits.
        Parameters:
        v - error term

      • mpy

        public void mpy(CalculatorValue v)
        The following methods implement computation of multiplication on the calculator values. These routines assume that the caller has verified that things are okay for the operation to take place. This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits.
        Parameters:
        v - pass the parameters for the computation

      • mpyE

        public void mpyE(CalculatorValue v,
                 CalculatorValue m,
                 CalculatorValue e,
                 CalculatorValue s)
        The following methods implement computation of subtraction for the error terms. These routines assume that the caller has verified that things are okay for the operation to take place. This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits.
        Parameters:
        v - = error term1
        m - = first operand
        e - = error term 2
        s - = second operand

This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits.
        Parameters:
        v - pass the parameters to calculate the result

        public void sqrt(CalculatorValue v)

This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits.
        Parameters:

                  CalculatorValue m)

This method perform the task by using the UNumber Library and can compute the values up to 25 significant digits.
        Parameters:
        v - = error term1
        m - = first operand

      • checkMeasureValue

        public static java.lang.String checkMeasureValue(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.

      • checkErrorTerm

        public static java.lang.String checkErrorTerm(java.lang.String input)
